front.title: The technical specification for the security content automation protocol (SCAP) version 1.3

author.organization: Information Technology Laboratory (National Institute of Standards and Technology)

front.abstract: The Security Content Automation Protocol (SCAP) is a suite of specifications that standardize the format and nomenclature by which software flaw and security configuration information is communicated, both to machines and humans. This publication, along with its annex (NIST Special Publication 800-126A) and a set of schemas, collectively define the technical composition of SCAP version 1.3 in terms of its component specifications, their interrelationships and interoperation, and the requirements for SCAP content.
